page.title: 03Trout Rearing Farm
page.content: A Trout Rearing Farm is situated at the base of the dam at Rutland Water. The eggs of the trout are hatched at nearby Horn Mill and come to the farm when they are 13 cms long. At the farm they are put into tanks about 1.4 metres deep. There are thirteen tanks each containing approximately 8,000 fish progressing from one tank to another as they grow. They are fed 54 times a day in the summer, 32 times in the winter. They are fed on fish pellets which provide lots of protein. The trout are released into the reservoir when they are 30 cms long. Three people work at the farm tending the trout and the tanks have to be cleaned out once a week.
